key_title: Key to the species of Ruppia

source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Potamogetonaceae (including Ruppiaceae)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Conn, B.J. (1994). Potamogetonaceae (including Ruppiaceae). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Fruiting carpels with stalk always longer than carpel
Flowers at water surface on maturity, retracted by tight coiling of axis after pollination
Flowers remaining below surface; inflorescence on an axis which is not or 1–3 times loosely coiled
Robust perennial; branches erect and conspicuous, up to 30 (–200) cm long; leaves 0.5–1 mm wide, undamaged apex 2-toothed or truncate; perennating swollen shoots absent
Annual or delicate perennial; branches not always obvious, up to 20 (–40) cm long; leaves usually less than 0.5 mm wide, undamaged apex obtuse or acute; perennating swollen shoots frequently present
